author: The Current
description:
Gregory Alan Isakov stopped into The Current studio before playing a show at the Palace Theater with Fruit Bats - who were a last-minute addition to the bill. The Colorado-based singer-songwriter chatted with Mac Wilson about lettuce farming, Bruce Springsteen and his latest album - Appaloosa Bones.

Watch Gregory Alan Isakov perform "The Fall" above. 

Musicians: 
‪@GregoryAlanIsakov‬ -- Vocals, Guitar & Banjo
Jeb Bows -- Violin & Vocals
John Grigsby -- Upright Bass, Vocals
Danny Black -- Guitar, Keys & Vocals
Steve Varney -- Banjo, Guitar & Vocals
Max Barcelow -- Harmonium, Vocals

Credits: 
Video Director -- Peter Ecklund
Camera Ops -- Peter Ecklund, Micah Kopecky
Audio -- Eric Xu Romani
Producer -- Derrick Stevens
Graphics -- Natalia Toledo
Digital Producer -- Natalia Toledo
title: Gregory Alan Isakov performing “The Fall” in The Current studio #gregoryalanisakov #shorts #music

author: The Current
description:
Austin and Taryn from Durry talk about the title track of their latest album, "This Movie Sucks," and how it's about when life doesn't exactly play out like a movie.

"The song is really about like when life doesn't follow the plot," Austin says. "We kind of had this huge breakthrough and this great hit song and got to do the tour and travel the world, do all the things we always dreamed of. This song is kind of about the day after that, when it's like, ‘Oh, that's when the credits should have rolled in our movie.’“

Durry play at First Avenue in Minneapolis on Friday, Sept. 12, and their North American tour kicks off October 7.
title: Hit Play: Durry talks about the title track of their latest album, "This Movie Sucks." #durry #music
